intro: Pavetta dolichosepala, commonly known as the long-sepal pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. Its sepals are elongated and often persist after flowering, giving the plant its common name. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
